Description: Fragment of a furnishing textile (cushion cover?) in undyed linen plain weave with loops (4cm long/every 1cm) and a square tapestry decoration; the centre of the square is a large medallion with a naked horseman in purple wool on a beige background, he wears a mantle on his shoulders and he holds a circular object in his right hand; the horse has a jewlled saddle and jumps towards the right; in each angle of the square is a medallion with a small human figure, naked but with a mantle on their shoulder, kneeling or running, holding an object (shield or spear); between each medallion is an animal (feline on either side, rabbit on top and bottom); the square is framed with a border freize of semi-circles in purple wool; plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/20), weft-undyed linen (S/8); tapestry on grouped threads: warp-undyed linen (S/7), weft-undyed linen (S/22), purple wool (S/48); flying threads: undyed linen (S); slit tapestry closed with oversewing (undyed linen /S spun Z ply); loops in undyed linen (S); all edges cut and ragged
Bibliographic references: Badawy 1978 / Coptic art and archaeology (4.71, p.290)
Budge 1922 / British Museum. Guide to the fourth, fifth and sixth Egyptian rooms, and the Coptic room (p.228) (Table case H, no. 11)
